definition[0]: a large untidy pile of things
example[1]: There was a heap of stones where the building used to be.
example[2]: The envelopes for posting lay in a heap on her desk.
example[3]: We piled the branches into heaps for burning.
definition[1]: an old car that is in bad condition
definition[2]: to put a lot of things on top of each other in an untidy way
example[4]: Jean heaped logs on the fire.
